intro: Hieracium schroeterianum, commonly known as the Schröter's hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring well-drained conditions. It produces yellow flowers with a distinctive central disk surrounded by ray florets. Hieracium schroeterianum is often found in open habitats and can spread through rhizomes, forming dense colonies.
